bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington

body.p: Territory of Washington }SS. County of Spokane
In the District Court of the Territory of Washington for the Fourth Judicial District thereof holding times as Spokane Falls, County of Spokane in said Territory.
In the matter of the application of John Dugan for a writ of Habeas Corpus
The petition of John Dugan respectfully shows

1st That he the said John Dugan is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by James Glispin Sheriff of Spokane County W.T. at the jail County Jail in Cheney in said County.
2nd That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal, and that the illegality thereof consists in this towit:

Wherefore to and on the 1st day of June, 1887 your petitioner was committed to Jail in default of giving $1500 bail. as required by Pierce a Justice of the peace in and for Spokane County W.A. to answer to the charge of being accessory to the crime of murder. Committed upon one Frank Teller in said County on the 30 day of May 1887; That upon the examination of your petitioner before said Pierce Justice of the Peace, there was not provided any evidence tending in any manner to implicate this petitioner in said murder nor anything tending to show he is guilty of the civil charges of being accessory thereof; but nevertheless the said Justice unlawfully held him to bail as aforesaid and he is and ever since has been unlawfully imprisoned and restrained of
his liberty by said James Glispin Sheriff-by reason of the premises as aforesaid.

Petitioner further states that on or about the 11th day of June 1887 one John J. Booge, a Justice of the Peace in and for the District County of Spokane W.T. held the petitioner in the case of The Territory of Washington as Mary Teller and required petitioner to finish bail in the sum of $1000. I as said witness that in deault thereof he was committed to the custody of James Glispin Sheriff as aforesaid who has ever said unlawfully imprisoned him and restrained him of his liberty because said amount of bail is extortionate and excessive -----

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to said James Glispin Sheriff as aforesaid commanding him to have the body of your petitioner before your honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and receive what shall then be considered by your Honor. Concerning your petition together with the civic and cause of his detention and this writ; and that your petitioner be restored to his liberty.
John Dugan by Turner + Forster His attorneys
Territory of Washington County of Spokane
George M Forster Being first duly sworn on oath states

that he is the attorney of the petitioner John Dugan and makes this affadavit in his behalf : that he has read the foregoing petition for Habeas Corpus. Knows the contents thereof and believes the cause to be true
Geo M. Forster Subscribed and sworn to before me this 29th day of June 1887.
Adolph Munth Notary Public Washington Territory
In the Clerk office District Court. Let the writ issue as heard in the petition returnable before me at chambers in Spokane Falls W.T at 10 o'clock a.d. July 29 1887
Dated Spokane Falls W.T. June 30 1887 George Turner, Judge
